data.title: Uncle Drew (2018)
data.summary: After draining his life savings to enter a team in the Rucker Classic street ball tournament in Harlem, Dax (Lil Rel Howery) is dealt a series of unfortunate setbacks, including losing his ...                See full summary »

data.title: Creed II (2018)
data.summary: Under the tutelage of Rocky Balboa, newly crowned light heavyweight champion Adonis Creed faces off against Viktor Drago, the son of Ivan Drago.

data.title: The Cannonball Run (1981)
data.summary: A wide variety of eccentric competitors participate in a wild and illegal cross-country road race. However, the eccentric entrants will do anything to win the road race, including low-down, dirty tricks.

data.title: Unbroken (I) (2014)
data.summary: After a near-fatal plane crash in WWII, Olympian Louis Zamperini spends a harrowing 47 days in a raft with two fellow crewmen before he's caught by the Japanese navy and sent to a prisoner-of-war camp.

data.title: I, Tonya (2017)
data.summary: Competitive ice skater Tonya Harding rises amongst the ranks at the U.S. Figure Skating Championships, but her future in the activity is thrown into doubt when her ex-husband intervenes.

data.title: A Prayer Before Dawn (2017)
data.summary: The true story of an English boxer incarcerated in one of Thailand's most notorious prisons as he fights in Muay Thai tournaments to earn his freedom.

data.title: Bring It On (2000)
data.summary: A champion high school cheerleading squad discovers its previous captain stole all their best routines from an inner-city school and must scramble to compete at this year's championships.

data.title: The Longest Yard (1974)
data.summary: A sadistic warden asks a former pro quarterback, now serving time in his prison, to put together a team of inmates to take on (and get pummeled by) the guards.

data.title: Summer Catch (2001)
data.summary: A rich girl whose family summers on Cape Cod has a romance with a local poor boy who hopes to become a major league baseball player.

data.title: Jerry Maguire (1996)
data.summary: When a sports agent has a moral epiphany and is fired for expressing it, he decides to put his new philosophy to the test as an independent agent with the only athlete who stays with him and his former secretary.

data.title: Remember the Titans (2000)
data.summary: The true story of a newly appointed African-American coach and his high school team on their first season as a racially integrated unit.

data.title: Battle of the Sexes (2017)
data.summary: The true story of the 1973 tennis match between World number one Billie Jean King and ex-champ and serial hustler Bobby Riggs.

data.title: The Longest Yard (2005)
data.summary: Prison inmates form a football team to challenge the prison guards.

data.title: Dodgeball: A True Underdog Story (2004)
data.summary: A group of misfits enter a Las Vegas dodgeball tournament in order to save their cherished local gym from the onslaught of a corporate health fitness chain.

data.title: Creed (2015)
data.summary: The former World Heavyweight Champion Rocky Balboa serves as a trainer and mentor to Adonis Johnson, the son of his late friend and former rival Apollo Creed.

data.title: The Waterboy (1998)
data.summary: A waterboy for a college football team discovers he has a unique tackling ability and becomes a member of the team.

data.title: Dangal (2016)
data.summary: Former wrestler Mahavir Singh Phogat and his two wrestler daughters struggle towards glory at the Commonwealth Games in the face of societal oppression.

data.title: The Blind Side (2009)
data.summary: The story of Michael Oher, a homeless and traumatized boy who became an All American football player and first round NFL draft pick with the help of a caring woman and her family.

data.title: Million Dollar Baby (2004)
data.summary: A determined woman works with a hardened boxing trainer to become a professional.

data.title: The Karate Kid (1984)
data.summary: A martial arts master agrees to teach karate to a bullied teenager.

data.title: Warrior (2011)
data.summary: The youngest son of an alcoholic former boxer returns home, where he's trained by his father for competition in a mixed martial arts tournament - a path that puts the fighter on a collision course with his estranged, older brother.

data.title: Rocky (1976)
data.summary: A small-time boxer gets a supremely rare chance to fight a heavy-weight champion in a bout in which he strives to go the distance for his self-respect.

data.title: Happy Gilmore (1996)
data.summary: A rejected hockey player puts his skills to the golf course to save his grandmother's house.

data.title: The Sandlot (1993)
data.summary: In the summer of 1962, a new kid in town is taken under the wing of a young baseball prodigy and his rowdy team, resulting in many adventures.

data.title: Foxcatcher (2014)
data.summary: U.S. Olympic wrestling champions and brothers Mark Schultz and Dave Schultz join "Team Foxcatcher", led by eccentric multi-millionaire John du Pont, as they train for the 1988 Olympic Games in Seoul, South Korea, but John's self-destructive behavior threatens to consume them all.

data.title: Mystery, Alaska (1999)
data.summary: This comedy is about the residents of a small town who get over-excited when their hockey team gets chosen to host a televised event

data.title: Southpaw (2015)
data.summary: A champion boxer fights to get his daughter back from child protective services as well as revive his professional career, after a fatal incident sends him on a rampant path of destruction.

data.title: Rush (I) (2013)
data.summary: The merciless 1970s rivalry between Formula One rivals James Hunt and Niki Lauda.

data.title: The Miracle Season (2018)
data.summary: After the tragic death of star volleyball player Caroline "Line" Found, a team of dispirited high school girls must band together under the guidance of their tough-love coach in hopes of winning the state championship.

data.title: The Fighter (I) (2010)
data.summary: Based on the story of Micky Ward, a fledgling boxer who tries to escape the shadow of his more famous but troubled older boxing brother and get his own shot at greatness.

data.title: Invincible (2006)
data.summary: Based on the story of Vince Papale, a 30-year-old bartender from South Philadelphia who overcame long odds to play for the NFL's Philadelphia Eagles in 1976.

data.title: She's the Man (2006)
data.summary: When her brother decides to ditch for a couple weeks, Viola heads over to his elite boarding school, disguised as him, and proceeds to fall for one of his soccer teammates, and soon learns she's not the only one with romantic troubles.

data.title: Moneyball (2011)
data.summary: Oakland A's general manager Billy Beane's successful attempt to assemble a baseball team on a lean budget by employing computer-generated analysis to acquire new players.

data.title: Caddyshack (1980)
data.summary: An exclusive golf course has to deal with a brash new member and a destructive dancing gopher.

data.title: Secretariat (2010)
data.summary: Penny Chenery Tweedy and colleagues guide her long-shot but precocious stallion to set, in 1973, the unbeaten record for winning the Triple Crown.

data.title: Borg McEnroe (2017)
data.summary: The story of the 1980 tennis rivalry between the placid Björn Borg and the volatile John McEnroe.

data.title: Campeones (I) (2018)
data.summary: A basketball coach is sentenced to community service, forced to work with a team of mentally disabled players.

data.title: The Karate Kid (2010)
data.summary: Work causes a single mother to move to China with her young son; in his new home, the boy embraces kung fu, taught to him by a master.

data.title: Any Given Sunday (1999)
data.summary: A behind-the-scenes look at the life-and-death struggles of modern-day gladiators and those who lead them.

data.title: Real Steel (2011)
data.summary: In the near future, robot boxing is a top sport. A struggling promoter feels he's found a champion in a discarded robot.

data.title: Nacho Libre (2006)
data.summary: Berated all his life by those around him, a monk follows his dream and dons a mask to moonlight as a Luchador (Mexican wrestler).

data.title: Field of Dreams (1989)
data.summary: An Iowa corn farmer, hearing voices, interprets them as a command to build a baseball diamond in his fields; he does, and the 1919 Chicago White Sox come.

data.title: Kingpin (1996)
data.summary: A star bowler whose career was prematurely "cut off" hopes to ride a new prodigy to success and riches.

data.title: A League of Their Own (1992)
data.summary: Two sisters join the first female professional baseball league and struggle to help it succeed amidst their own growing rivalry.

data.title: The Natural (1984)
data.summary: An unknown comes seemingly out of nowhere to become a legendary player with almost divine talent.

data.title: Raging Bull (1980)
data.summary: The life of boxer Jake LaMotta, as the violence and temper that leads him to the top in the ring destroys his life outside of it.

data.title: Talladega Nights: The Ballad of Ricky Bobby (2006)
data.summary: Number one NASCAR driver Ricky Bobby stays atop the heap thanks to a pact with his best friend and teammate, Cal Naughton, Jr. But when a French Formula One driver, makes his way up the ladder, Ricky Bobby's talent and devotion are put to the test.

data.title: Semi-Tough (1977)
data.summary: A three-way friendship between two free-spirited professional football players and the owner's daughter becomes compromised when two of them become romantically involved.

data.title: Bloodsport (1988)
data.summary: Follows Frank Dux, an American martial artist serving in the military, who decides to leave the army to compete in a martial arts tournament in Hong Kong where fights to the death can occur.

data.title: Stroker Ace (1983)
data.summary: The title character, a popular NASCAR driver, clashes with the fried-chicken mogul that sponsors his racing team.

data.title: Never Back Down (2008)
data.summary: A frustrated and conflicted teenager arrives at a new high school to discover an underground fight club and meet a classmate who begins to coerce him into fighting.

data.title: Cinderella Man (2005)
data.summary: The story of James Braddock, a supposedly washed-up boxer who came back to become a champion and an inspiration in the 1930s.

data.title: Rocky IV (1985)
data.summary: Rocky Balboa proudly holds the world heavyweight boxing championship, but a new challenger has stepped forward: Drago, a six-foot-four, 261-pound fighter who has the backing of the Soviet Union.

data.title: Varsity Blues (1999)
data.summary: A back-up quarterback is chosen to lead a Texas football team to victory after the star quarterback is injured.

data.title: Handsome Devil (2016)
data.summary: Ned and Conor are forced to share a bedroom at their boarding school. The loner and the star athlete at this rugby-mad school form an unlikely friendship until it's tested by the authorities.

data.title: Point Break (2015)
data.summary: A young FBI agent infiltrates an extraordinary team of extreme sports athletes he suspects of masterminding a string of unprecedented, sophisticated corporate heists.

data.title: Whip It (2009)
data.summary: In Bodeen, Texas, an indie-rock loving misfit finds a way of dealing with her small-town misery after she discovers a roller derby league in nearby Austin.

data.title: Rocky Balboa (2006)
data.summary: Thirty years after the ring of the first bell, Rocky Balboa comes out of retirement and dons his gloves for his final fight; against the reigning heavyweight champ Mason 'The Line' Dixon.

data.title: The Wrestler (2008)
data.summary: A faded professional wrestler must retire, but finds his quest for a new life outside the ring a dispiriting struggle.

data.title: Breath (I) (2017)
data.summary: Based on Tim Winton's award-winning and international bestselling novel set in mid-70s coastal Australia. Two teenage boys, hungry for discovery, form an unlikely friendship with a ...                See full summary »

data.title: Gold (I) (2018)
data.summary: Set in 1948, the historic story of India's first Olympic medal post their independence.

data.title: The Basketball Diaries (1995)
data.summary: A teenager finds his dreams of becoming a basketball star threatened after he free falls into the harrowing world of drug addiction.

data.title: Friday Night Lights (2004)
data.summary: Based on H.G. Bissinger's book, which profiled the economically depressed town of Odessa, Texas and their heroic high school football team, The Permian High Panthers.

data.title: The Mighty Ducks (1992)
data.summary: A self-centered Minnesota lawyer is sentenced to community service coaching a rag tag youth hockey team.

data.title: Concussion (2015)
data.summary: In Pittsburgh, accomplished pathologist Dr. Bennet Omalu uncovers the truth about brain damage in football players who suffer repeated concussions in the course of normal play.

data.title: Rudy (1993)
data.summary: Rudy has always been told that he was too small to play college football. But he is determined to overcome the odds and fulfill his dream of playing for Notre Dame.

data.title: Coach Carter (2005)
data.summary: Controversy surrounds high school basketball coach Ken Carter after he benches his entire team for breaking their academic contract with him.

data.title: Hooligans (2005)
data.summary: A wrongfully expelled Harvard undergrad moves to London, where he is introduced to the violent underworld of football hooliganism.

data.title: The Game Plan (2007)
data.summary: An NFL quarterback living the bachelor lifestyle discovers that he has an 8-year-old daughter from a previous relationship.

data.title: Blades of Glory (2007)
data.summary: In 2002, two rival Olympic ice skaters were stripped of their gold medals and permanently banned from men's single competition. Presently, however, they've found a loophole that will allow them to qualify as a pairs team.

data.title: Rocky II (1979)
data.summary: Rocky struggles in family life after his bout with Apollo Creed, while the embarrassed champ insistently goads him to accept a challenge for a rematch.

data.title: Bend It Like Beckham (2002)
data.summary: The daughter of orthodox Sikh rebels against her parents' traditionalism and joins a football team.

data.title: Heaven Can Wait (1978)
data.summary: A Los Angeles Rams quarterback, accidentally taken away from his body by an overanxious angel before he was meant to die, returns to life in the body of a recently murdered millionaire.

data.title: Little Giants (1994)
data.summary: Misfits form their own opposing team to an elite peewee football team, coached by the elite team coach's brother.

data.title: Yip Man (2008)
data.summary: During the Japanese invasion of 1937, when a wealthy martial artist is forced to leave his home and work to support his family, he reluctantly agrees to train others in the art of Wing Chun for self-defense.

data.title: Days of Thunder (1990)
data.summary: A young hot-shot stock car driver gets his chance to compete at the top level.

data.title: The Merger (2018)
data.summary: Troy Carrington, a former professional football player returns to his country town after an abrupt end to his sporting career and is persuaded to coach the hapless local footy team, the Roosters.

data.title: Speed Racer (2008)
data.summary: A young driver, Speed Racer, aspires to be champion of the racing world with the help of his family and his high-tech Mach 5 automobile.

data.title: Over the Top (1987)
data.summary: Tough trucker Lincoln Hawk is determined to win back his son and triumph at the world arm wrestling championships.

data.title: Soul Surfer (2011)
data.summary: Teenage surfer Bethany Hamilton overcomes the odds and her own fears of returning to the water after losing her left arm in a shark attack.
In 1947, Jackie Robinson becomes the first African-American to play in Major League Baseball in the modern era when he was signed by the Brooklyn Dodgers and faces considerable racism in the process.

data.title: Semi-Pro (2008)
data.summary: Jackie Moon, the owner-coach-player of the American Basketball Association's Flint Michigan Tropics, rallies his teammates to make their NBA dreams come true.

data.title: Blue Crush (2002)
data.summary: As a hard-core surfer girl prepares for a big competition, she finds herself falling for a football player.

data.title: The Replacements (2000)
data.summary: During a pro football strike, the owners hire substitute players.

data.title: Draft Day (I) (2014)
data.summary: At the NFL Draft, General Manager Sonny Weaver has the opportunity to rebuild his team when he trades for the number one pick. He must decide what he's willing to sacrifice on a life-changing day for a few hundred young men with NFL dreams.

data.title: Rocky V (1990)
data.summary: Reluctantly retired from boxing, and back from riches to rags, Rocky takes on a new protege who betrays him, as the champ's son must adjust to his family's new life after bankruptcy.

data.title: Icarus (I) (2017)
data.summary: When Bryan Fogel sets out to uncover the truth about doping in sports, a chance meeting with a Russian scientist transforms his story from a personal experiment into a geopolitical thriller...                See full summary »

data.title: Lionheart (1990)
data.summary: An Ex-French Soldier begins participating in underground street fights in order to make money for his brother's family.

data.title: Journeyman (I) (2017)
data.summary: Boxer Matty Burton suffers a serious head injury during a fight. It is about the impact this has on his marriage, his life and and his family.

data.title: Back to School (1986)
data.summary: To help his discouraged son get through college, a funloving and obnoxious rich businessman decides to enter the school as a student himself.

data.title: Necessary Roughness (1991)
data.summary: Due to NCAA sanctions, the Texas State University Fightin' Armadillos must form a football team from their actual student body, with no scholarships to help, to play their football schedule...                See full summary »

data.title: Major League (1989)
data.summary: The new owner of the Cleveland Indians puts together a purposely horrible team so they'll lose and she can move the team. But when the plot is uncovered, they start winning just to spite her.

data.title: Driven (2001)
data.summary: A young hot shot driver is in the middle of a championship season and is coming apart at the seams. A former CART champion is called in to give him guidance.

data.title: Rocky III (1982)
data.summary: After winning the ultimate title and being the world champion, Rocky falls into a hole and finds himself picked up by a former enemy.

data.title: Cool Runnings (1993)
data.summary: When a Jamaican sprinter is disqualified from the Olympic Games, he enlists the help of a dishonored coach to start the first Jamaican Bobsled Team.

data.title: Hard Ball (2001)
data.summary: An aimless young man who is scalping tickets, gambling, and drinking, agrees to coach a Little League team from the Cabrini Green housing project in Chicago as a condition of getting a loan from a friend.
